flow.descriptionCdata:
5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.3ba32eb5-99a8-4bbd-9d4b-970eb37f6cca.prompt=Notification Method\: 5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.45c51f9b-6ce3-47a7-8db1-d35094f59b6a.description=
Allows a user to select how they will be notified of the outcome of a flow. 

Inputs\:
    notifydata -  The message to be displayed / the content of the email / the text to be saved to file
    notifyMethod - The notification method (file, email, display)
    subject - A description of the notification
    destination - For file\: the file to write to; for email\: the email address to send to
    notificationServer - The name of the server to notify (e.g. an email server) if the method selected is to a server
    from - The originator of the message (email "from" address)
    sourceServer - The name of a mid-tier server when using integrations with multi-level server architecture for processing tickets
    serverPort - The port on which the server is running
    username - The username to use for a notification method that requires authentication
    password - The password for username

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully
5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.4abc26aa-589f-4bec-8451-82ebc95f3120.prompt=Notification option\: 5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.6547e34c-4e73-465f-a520-efd1639172c4.description=

    sourceServer - The name of a mid-tier server when using integrations with multi-level server architecture for processing tickets
    serverPort - The port on which the server is running
    username - The username to use for a notification method that requires authentication
    password - The password for username

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully
5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.7ff4e9b8-6977-4811-835d-7002808796ef.prompt=Notification option\: 5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.8eec38ea-a77e-4a86-86d1-e735eb8078f6.description=

5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.989fd57a-44c4-492e-aa33-34cdaf5f2739.description=
Retrieves the DN of the root domain in active directory.

Inputs\:
    host - An active directory domain controller
    altuser - The user to be used to authenticate with the host
    altpassword - The password for altuser

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully
5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.ace40b8d-805c-4b94-af88-ea9021f0cdd5.description=
Generates an HTML table from a list of data.

Inputs\:
    tableData - The list to generate the table from
    columnDelimiter - A delimiter that separates between columns in the tableData
    rowDelimiter - A delimiter that separates between rows in tableData

Returns\:
    An HTML-formatted table

Responses\:
   success - The operation completed as stated in the description
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully
5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.b2970ffe-7edd-4bb0-a1cd-d5882d002d7c.description=
Finds all users who have not logged in for the last "daysOld" days.

Inputs\:
host - A domain controller to enumerate all domain controllers from.
DN - The Distinguished name to read users from.
baseDN - The base DN of your domain. For example DC\=domain,DC\=com for domain.com.
groupDN - The DN of the group to check, for example\: CN\=Domain Users,CN\=Users,DC\=Domain,DC\=com.
username - The username to use for LDAP queries.
password - The password to use for LDAP queries.
daysOld - Integer positive value, representing the number of days ago user must have logged in since in order to be considered active.

Primary Output\:
returnResult - A table containing the distinguished names, and the last login times of the users who are inactive. The first column is distinguished named. The rows are | delimited, and the columns are ; delimited.

Additional outputs\:
InactiveUsers -  A table containing the distinguished names, and the last login times of the users who are inactive.

Responses\:
success - No inactive users were found.
diagnosed - Inactive users were found.
failure - Something went wrong.
5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.description=
Finds all domain adminstrators who have not logged in recently.

Inputs\:
    host - A domain controller to enumerate all domain controllers from
    DN - The Distinguished Name of the Organization Unit containing the domain administrators to be reviewed
    username - Username to use for LDAP queries
    password - Password to use for LDAP queries
    daysOld - The maximum number of days passed since the domain administrator logged in, in order to still be considered active
    notifyMethod - How to notify the domain administrator of the results of the flow

Responses\:
    success - No inactive domain administrators were found
    diagnosed - Inactive domain administrators were found
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully

Results\: 
    Displays a summary of the flow's results
5f54187b-e2be-453f-9856-ec89caa5e48e.fc2ee83f-24f3-42d1-ba75-f714ef43dd7f.prompt=Notification option\:
flow.name: Find Inactive Domain Administrators

staticBinding.value:
The following users have not been active in the last ${daysOld} days.

${table}
Inactive Users Found in Active Directory
The flow 'Find Inactive Users' Attempted to run, but an unknown error occurred.

The following users have not been active in the last ${daysOld} days.

${table}
Inactive Users Found in Active Directory
